meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Israel.
meanings.sent1: In Israel, you can buy many things with a sheqel.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for sheqels at the bank.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sheqel go to school? To learn how to multiply!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was worth more than any sheqel.
meanings.sent5: The shiny sheqel sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to about 11.4 grams.
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for a sheqel of flour.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler measured the gold in sheqels.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sheqel refuse to be weighed? It didn't want to be under pressure!
meanings.sent4: His words carried the sheqel of truth.
meanings.sent5: The sheqel felt heavy in her hand, a measure of precious metal.
